text.p: Here are the highlights from Swiss newspapers on Tuesday:

- Corruption in Switzerland is minor. The increasing number of corruption cases in public administration, however, signals certain danger potential, a study of the Swiss Ministry for Police and Justice said.
- Copyright organisation 'Pro Litteris' plans to introduce a tax for computers, which would be similar to the taxation of photo copies.
- Swiss-Swedish group ABB to take over GEC Meters -- largest British manufacturer of electricity meters.
- Swissair fired a pilot because he published a critical article in the official pilots' magazine
- Swiss travel group Kuoni to take over Swiss charter airline Edelweiss Air.

- Several Swiss newspapers did not publish a political ad of the Swiss Peolpe's Party. The newspapers said that the content of the ad violated two ponits of the 'criteria for acceepting a political ad.' The Swiss People's Party, represented by Chistoph Blocher and Hans Uhlmann, said at a press conference that the party will distribute the ad via direct mail.
